title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributing to asanar
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("jonthegeek/asanar", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to asanar
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Establish a webhook — asn_create_webhook
text: Establishing webhook two-part process. First, simple HTTP POST request initiates creation similar creating resource.  Next, middle request comes confirmation handshake. webhook created, send test POST target X-Hook-Secret header. target must respond 200 OK 204 Content matching X-Hook-Secret header confirm webhook subscription indeed expected. strongly recommend storing secret used verify future webhook event signatures.  POST request create webhook return status request. acknowledge webhook’s confirmation handshake fail setup, receive error response attempt create . means need able receive complete webhook POST request -flight (words, server can handle requests asynchronously).  Invalid hostnames like localhost recieve 403 Forbidden status code.  # Request curl -H "Authorization: Bearer <personal_access_token>" \ -X POST https://app.asana.com/api/1.0/webhooks \ -d "resource=8675309" \ -d "target=https://example.com/receive-webhook/7654"  # Handshake sent https://example.com/ POST /receive-webhook/7654 X-Hook-Secret: b537207f20cbfa02357cf448134da559e8bd39d61597dcd5631b8012eae53e81  # Handshake response sent example.com HTTP/1.1 200 X-Hook-Secret: b537207f20cbfa02357cf448134da559e8bd39d61597dcd5631b8012eae53e81  # Response HTTP/1.1 201 {   "data": {     "gid": "43214",     "resource": {       "gid": "8675309",       "name": "Bugs"     },     "target": "https://example.com/receive-webhook/7654",     "active": false,     "last_success_at": null,     "last_failure_at": null,     "last_failure_content": null   } }
